body_html: I think we should pull this in as soon as these comments are done and we know there's a way to build & run the tests. The one thing I'd ask is that you put a comment in the example imagenet program that says this isn't really the right way to do it - pending a way to modify the graphdef, it's much more efficient to directly couple the input and recognition path so that the image doesn't get copied back to python/CPU between the steps. :)
body_text: I think we should pull this in as soon as these comments are done and we know there's a way to build & run the tests.  The one thing I'd ask is that you put a comment in the example imagenet program that says this isn't really the right way to do it - pending a way to modify the graphdef, it's much more efficient to directly couple the input and recognition path so that the image doesn't get copied back to python/CPU between the steps. :)
body: I think we should pull this in as soon as these comments are done and we know there's a way to build & run the tests.  The one thing I'd ask is that you put a comment in the example imagenet program that says this isn't really the right way to do it - pending a way to modify the graphdef, it's much more efficient to directly couple the input and recognition path so that the image doesn't get copied back to python/CPU between the steps. :)
